newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks flat at noon, seen range-bound.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks flat at noon, seen range-bound.

text.p: Pakistan stocks were little changed at noon on Thursday in lacklustre trading as the country's weak economic fundamentals deterred investors and dealers said the index would be range-bound in the near-term.
"There is no action today. It is a dull and stagnant market," dealer Dawar Hasan said. "Investors are on the sidelines because of concerns about Pakistan's economy."
The index fell 0.74 points, or 0.05 percent, to 1,541.15 at noon. Losers led gainers 161 to 71. PTCL rose 0.25 rupee to 25.
